Description: Brazilian cowbell similar to Agogo bells
Small Frame drum from Iberia, Portugal and Brazil
Wind chimes made from small bells
Wind machine

Description: An instrument made to sound by wind or air movement. Examples include whistle, siren, bull roarer and pop gun
Afuche
Afuche

Description: Talking drum
Thumb piano
Berimbau
Cabasa
Brazilian rattle similar to the afuche but with a coconut shell body
Two different sized conical shaped bells connected by a u shaped rod and struck with a beater. Usually made of metal, they are used in Latin American and African music

An African instrument consisting of a long flat metal chamber which is open at one end. Held in one hand and struck with a wooden stick whilst the open end is covered and uncovered creating muted and open sounds
Heavy cast bronze or brass bell
Spanish: Campana de señales, Campana de alarma

Description: Almglocken
Tuned percussion instrument with aluminium bars, a predecesor of the Vibraphone
Instrument manufactured by the Deagan company which consists of  series of aluminium or nickel-plated tubes. These are rubbed with rosined gloves, creating an effect similar to musical glasses
Ethiopian xylophone similat to a Mexican marimba or Lamellaphone similar to Mbira
Drum with a wood or clay shell played by Native American Indian tribes
Italian: Tamburo Indiano d' America, Tamburo indiano
